text: The women's coxless pair competition at the 2018 World Rowing Championships in Plovdiv took place at the Plovdiv Regatta Venue. ==Schedule== The schedule was as follows: {| class="wikitable" ! Date ! Time ! Round |- | Sunday 9 September 2018 || 10:34 || Heats |- | Tuesday 11 September 2018 || 10:49 || Repechage |- | Thursday 13 September 2018 || 11:18 || Semifinals A/B |- | rowspan=3|Saturday 15 September 2018 || 09:38 || Final B |- | style=background:lemonchiffon| 11:30 ||style=background:lemonchiffon| Final A |- | 14:45 || Final C |} All times are Eastern European Summer Time (UTC+3) ==Results== ===Heats=== The three fastest boats in each heat advanced directly to the A/B semifinals. The remaining boats were sent to the repechage. ====Heat 1==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Grace Prendergast Kerri Gowler | align="left"| | 6:56.06 | SA/B |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 2 | align="left"|Aifric Keogh Emily Hegarty | align="left"| | 7:11.51 | SA/B |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 3 | align="left"|Victoria Opitz Gia Doonan | align="left"| | 7:13.02 | SA/B |- | 4 | align="left"|Addy Dunkley-Smith Hannah Vermeersch | align="left"| | 7:16.10 | R |- | 5 | align="left"|Oksana Holub Anna Kontseva | align="left"| | 7:17.16 | R |} ====Heat 2==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Rowan McKellar Harriet Taylor | align="left"| | 7:07.92 | SA/B |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 2 | align="left"|Lin Xinyu Ju Rui | align="left"| | 7:09.73 | SA/B |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 3 | align="left"|Alessandra Patelli Sara Bertolasi | align="left"| | 7:11.85 | SA/B |- | 4 | align="left"|Hermijntje Drenth Willeke Vossen | align="left"| | 7:23.18 | R |- | 5 | align="left"|Anna Aksenova Valentina Plaksina | align="left"| | 7:23.20 | R |} ====Heat 3==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Caileigh Filmer Hillary Janssens | align="left"| | 7:09.23 | SA/B |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 2 | align="left"|Anna Boada Aina Cid | align="left"| | 7:15.71 | SA/B |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 3 | align="left"|Dóra Polivka Eszter Krémer | align="left"| | 7:27.64 | SA/B |- | 4 | align="left"|Flavie Bahuaud Marie Le Nepvou | align="left"| | 7:34.99 | R |- | 5 | align="left"|Anna Wierzbowska Monika Sobieszek | align="left"| | 7:55.26 | R |} ===Repechage=== The three fastest boats advanced to the A/B semifinals. The remaining boats were sent to the C final. {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Anna Aksenova Valentina Plaksina | align="left"| | 7:14.15 | SA/B |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 2 | align="left"|Addy Dunkley-Smith Hannah Vermeersch | align="left"| | 7:14.88 | SA/B |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 3 | align="left"|Oksana Holub Anna Kontseva | align="left"| | 7:17.23 | SA/B |- | 4 | align="left"|Hermijntje Drenth Willeke Vossen | align="left"| | 7:17.54 | FC |- | 5 | align="left"|Anna Wierzbowska Monika Sobieszek | align="left"| | 7:27.78 | FC |- | 6 | align="left"|Flavie Bahuaud Marie Le Nepvou | align="left"| | 7:37.08 | FC |} ===Semifinals=== The three fastest boats in each semi advanced to the A final. The remaining boats were sent to the B final. ====Semifinal 1==== {|class="wikitable" style="text- align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Caileigh Filmer Hillary Janssens | align="left"| | 6:58.57 | FA |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 2 | align="left"|Grace Prendergast Kerri Gowler | align="left"| | 7:00.32 | FA |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 3 | align="left"|Lin Xinyu Ju Rui | align="left"| | 7:14.48 | FA |- | 4 | align="left"|Addy Dunkley-Smith Hannah Vermeersch | align="left"| | 7:17.40 | FB |- | 5 | align="left"|Oksana Holub Anna Kontseva | align="left"| | 7:24.72 | FB |- | 6 | align="left"|Dóra Polivka Eszter Krémer | align="left"| | 7:32.07 | FB |} ====Semifinal 2==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Aifric Keogh Emily Hegarty | align="left"| | 7:14.67 | FA |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 2 | align="left"|Alessandra Patelli Sara Bertolasi | align="left"| | 7:14.99 | FA |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 3 | align="left"|Anna Boada Aina Cid | align="left"| | 7:15.30 | FA |- | 4 | align="left"|Victoria Opitz Gia Doonan | align="left"| | 7:16.61 | FB |- | 5 | align="left"|Rowan McKellar Harriet Taylor | align="left"| | 7:17.95 | FB |- | 6 | align="left"|Anna Aksenova Valentina Plaksina | align="left"| | 7:29.11 | FB |} ===Finals=== The A final determined the rankings for places 1 to 6. Additional rankings were determined in the other finals. ====Final C==== {|class="wikitable" style="text- align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time |- | 1 | align="left"|Anna Wierzbowska Monika Sobieszek | align="left"| | 7:20.04 |- | 2 | align="left"|Hermijntje Drenth Willeke Vossen | align="left"| | 7:22.35 |- | 3 | align="left"|Flavie Bahuaud Marie Le Nepvou | align="left"| | 7:30.83 |} ====Final B==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time |- | 1 | align="left"|Rowan McKellar Harriet Taylor | align="left"| | 7:17.46 |- | 2 | align="left"|Addy Dunkley- Smith Hannah Vermeersch | align="left"| | 7:18.94 |- | 3 | align="left"|Victoria Opitz Gia Doonan | align="left"| | 7:19.70 |- | 4 | align="left"|Oksana Holub Anna Kontseva | align="left"| | 7:24.76 |- | 5 | align="left"|Anna Aksenova Valentina Plaksina | align="left"| | 7:27.48 |- | 6 | align="left"|Dóra Polivka Eszter Krémer | align="left"| | 7:36.96 |} ====Final A==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time |- | | align="left"|Caileigh Filmer Hillary Janssens | align="left"| | 6:50.67 |- | | align="left"|Grace Prendergast Kerri Gowler | align="left"| | 6:52.96 |- | | align="left"|Anna Boada Aina Cid | align="left"| | 7:04.60 |- | 4 | align="left"|Alessandra Patelli Sara Bertolasi | align="left"| | 7:06.91 |- | 5 | align="left"|Lin Xinyu Ju Rui | align="left"| | 7:11.31 |- | 6 | align="left"|Aifric Keogh Emily Hegarty | align="left"| | 7:15.70 |} ==References== Category:2018 World Rowing Championships World
title: 2018 World Rowing Championships – Women's coxless pair
